official-title.#text:
To direct certain actions of the United States Government with respect to recognizing the service
			 and sacrifice of veterans of the Korean Constabulary, and for other
			 purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committees on

, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such
			 provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Recognizing Officers and Enlisted Men of the Korean Constabulary Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
Congress finds the following:

From November 1945 to January 1949, the Korean Constabulary undertook internal security tasks on
			 behalf of the United States Military Government in Korea and the people of
			 South Korea.

The Korean Constabulary was initially intended to supplement United States military operations
			 during the unification and independence of South Korea.

Within two years of its organization, the Korean Constabulary consisted of 25,000 officers and
			 enlisted men.

Civil conflict in Korea compelled officers and enlisted men of the Korean Constabulary to defend
			 their fledgling country against internal unrest.

The Korean Constabulary was under the jurisdiction of the Department of National Defense, which
			 later became known as the Department of Internal Security of the United
			 States Military Government in Korea.

The Korean Constabulary was the core force upon which the Korean Army was established on August 5,
			 1948.

The Korean Government excluded officers and enlisted men of the Korean Constabulary from benefits
			 when it enacted the Republic of Korea’s Military Pension Act, specifically
			 Article 16–9, which states that the calculation of service period shall
			 not include years prior to 1948, the establishment year of the Government
			 of the Republic of Korea.

Veterans of the Korean Constabulary believe they have been treated unfairly because they have not
			 been granted pension or aid for healthcare and have been denied Korean
			 military awards and distinguished honors, such as promotion, because their
			 years of service before January 1949 are unaccounted for.

The Government of the Republic of Korea owes veterans of the Korean Constabulary due compensation
			 for their service to the Government of the Republic of Korea.

Veterans of the Korean Constabulary would like to be honored by the Republic of Korea for their
			 service to the Korean Constabulary.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
commends the veterans of the Korean Constabulary for their bravery and honorable service
			 and thanks them for their support during the difficult times leading to
			 the establishment of the Republic of Korea.
shall seek to urge the Government of the Republic of Korea—

text.#text: The

header.#text: Actions with respect to Government of the Republic of Korea

text.#text: to reexamine Article 16–9 of the Republic of Korea’s Military Pension Act; and
to expeditiously locate the records and remains of 7,235 combat dead of the Korean Constabulary.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report that contains the following:

text.#text: The

A description of potential awards and recognition for officers and enlisted men of the Korean
			 Constabulary.

If no such awards or recognition would apply, an examination of the possibility of establishing new
			 such awards and recognition.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, is amended by adding at the end the following new
			 paragraph:

text.#text:
An individual who served as an officer or enlisted man of the Korean Constabulary and at the time
			 of death—

was a citizen of the United States or an alien lawfully admitted for permanent residence in the
			 United States; and
resided in the United States.

term.#tail:
means the constabulary force that provided internal security in Korea on behalf of the United
			 States Military Government in Korea from November 1945 to January 1949.
